snippet: With the city of Homs reported to be under renewed bombardment, a senior Russian envoy held talks with President Bashar al-Assad on Tuesday.
abstract: Russia sends a senior envoy to Syria for peace talks in an attempt to counter mounting criticism over its support for Pres Bashar al-Assad and its veto of an Arab League-backed resolution against him; effort comes as a growing number of Arab and European countries recall their ambassadors from Damascus in outrage over Assad's increasingly violent repression of the popular uprising in Syria.

byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz reported from Moscow, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Anthony Shadid, Nada Bakri and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: With the city of Homs reported to be under renewed bombardment, a senior Russian envoy held talks with President Bashar al-Assad on Tuesday.

headline.seo: Russia Sends Envoys to Syria to Defuse Crisis
headline.main: Stung by Criticism, Russia Sends Envoys to Syria to Defuse Crisis
headline.print_headline: Stung by Criticism, Russia Sends Envoys to Syria to Defuse Crisis
